entry.gloss: flee, patriam fugio - to go into exile
O...! A particle for addressing someone directly
the river Arar, a river in Gaul
the river Oaxes, a river in Crete
the river Tigris, a river in the Euphrates
to be away from, be absent
very, very much; likewise; (usque adeo: "so much")
elsewhere, somewhere else, at another place
ear of corn; (poet. pl.) a crop of grain
to try to get, try to capture, seek
to pick, pluck off, crop gather
to get to know, learn, understand; (perf.) to know
to till, tend, care for, cultivate
to bring together, collect, heap up
care, attention; (l. 58) object of care, pet
to eat up, feed on, consume
to set down, abandon, leave alone
to carry out; take away, remove; lift up
for; namely, I mean, in fact
indeed, at least; (with first person) for my part
left; (of omens) unfavourable; (l. 16) "ruled by an ill omen"
(impers.) it is lawful, is allowed, is permitted
come to know, learn, be familiar with, know
newly ploughed land, fallow land, field
little, small; (superl. adv. minime) not at all
to hang, hang down, be suspended
to suspend, weigh, weigh out; pay; value (w gen)
to be able, have power, can
to lead forth, lead forward; bring up
however much, as ... as you like, although
to look back (upon), gaze at, look for
to surround with a hedge, hedge in, fence in, enclose

entry.pp: sēnī, sēnae, sēna; gen. m. \& n. ~um

entry.gloss: be used to, be wont, be accustomed
(of animals) to rear, raise; let down, lower
so much, to such a degree
to handle, touch, feel; try; afflict
to make an uproar, disturb, be in disorder
(right) up to, continuously so much; (with adeo) "so much"
